result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Checots was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete anger management counseling. Submit DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey

Cases heard: 15CM657 & 16CF90, Defendant, Richard A Checots, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint filed; reading waived. Court went over the right to an attorney. Defendant waived attorney. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead no contest to counts 2&3 in 15CM657 & counts 1&3 in 16CF90. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 years probation in each case. In 15CM657, costs of $543 & $243. In 16CF90, $443, $243 costs. In both cases - Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete anger management counseling. Submit DNA sample.  Court granted 3 days jail credit in 16CF90 and 3 days in 15CM657.  All other counts read in and dismissed. Cash bond applied.

Defendant, Richard A Checots, appeared. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 16CF90 and 15CM657.  Defendant would like to argue the sentencing.  Does not want attorney.  This will be set with Br. 2 for an argued plea/sentencing hearing.

Defendant, Richard A Checots, appeared pro se. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant trying to get attorney. Right to court-appointed attorney explained. Court wanted Defendant to contact public defender today and come back into court. He has no time to do that today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:20 am.  Return date scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
absolute sobriety, no acts/threats of violence towards T.C.

Defendant, Richard A Checots, appeared. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. $2,000.00 sign bond, absolute sobriety, no acts/threats of violence towards T.C.,  posted bond to be returned,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Return date scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
